title: Batwoman spoiler: Ruby Rose films new scenes for The CW series in Vancouver
text:
Ruby Rose has reprised her role as Batwoman after taking time off from filming The CW series earlier this year when a stunt went horribly wrong.

The Australian actress, 33, was was pictured filming scenes in Vancouver, Canada on Monday and appeared to be fighting fit once again.

In September, Ruby revealed she had to undergo emergency surgery after suffering two herniated discs on set several months earlier.

Scroll down for video

She's back! Ruby Rose (pictured) has reprised her role as Batwoman after taking time off from filming The CW series earlier this year when a stunt went horribly wrong

Ruby looked healthy and strong while back in her superhero costume and red wig.

Clutching a prop gun, she appeared to be in her element while playing Gotham City's new symbol of hope, the vigilante Batwoman.

A masked villain was also seen on set, clutching a rifle as a shoot-out commenced.

Ready to save Gotham City! The Australian actress, 33, was was pictured filming scenes in Vancouver, Canada on Monday and appeared to be fighting fit once again

Recovered! In September, Ruby revealed she had to undergo emergency surgery after suffering two herniated discs on set several months earlier

Taking to Instagram in September, Ruby revealed her health scare to fans while sharing footage of herself undergoing emergency surgery.

She wrote: 'To everyone asking about my new Pez dispenser scar on my neck, a couple of months ago I was told I needed an emergency surgery or I was risking becoming paralysed.

'I had herniated two discs doing stunts, and they were close to severing my spinal chord. I was in chronic pain and yet couldn't feel my arms.'

Fight club! A masked villain was also seen on set, clutching a rifle as a shoot-out commenced

Ruby stars as Kate Kane, Bruce Wayne's cousin, who shares his secret penchant for late hours of vigilante work.

The show premiered across America last week to rave reviews, with many fans already calling for a second season.

Filming for season one began in March, and is set to wrap in December, with Ruby's injury believed to have stalled production for a while.

Emergency! Taking to Instagram in September, Ruby revealed her health scare to fans while sharing footage of herself undergoing emergency surgery
description: In September, Ruby  revealed she had to undergo emergency surgery after suffering two herniated discs on set several months ago
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
